title: 104_hr4132
content: The Act is titled the "Robert Stodola Homeless Veterans Assistance Act" and includes a definition of a veteran for the purposes of the Act. It also establishes an Emergency Shelter Grants Program. Section 413 of the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to ensure that at least 20 percent of the total assistance received by metropolitan cities, urban counties, States, and Indian tribes is used for eligible activities benefiting homeless veterans. The Secretary may waive or reduce this requirement upon request. The Secretary may waive or reduce the requirement for at least 20 percent of assistance to be used for eligible activities benefiting homeless veterans if the city, county, State, or tribe demonstrates that the assistance will remain unused for an unreasonable period of time. The supportive housing program is outlined in Section 4. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include selection criteria and a specific allocation for veterans' share. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to allocate 20 percent for projects benefiting homeless veterans, with the Secretary having the authority to waive or reduce this percentage if funds are at risk of remaining unused. SEC. 5. SAFE HAVENS FOR HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include selection criteria and a Veterans' Share provision, ensuring compliance and allocating at least 20% of funds for eligible activities. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to allocate funds for eligible activities benefiting homeless veterans, with the Secretary having the authority to waive or reduce requirements if funds remain unused. SEC. 6. SECTION 8 PROGRAM FOR SINGLE ROOM OCCUPANCY DWELLINGS. Amendment to the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act requires at least 20% of funds to benefit homeless veterans. Compliance with subsection (k) is necessary. The Secretary can reduce the percentage of funds if unused for a long time. SEC. 7. SHELTER PLUS CARE PROGRAM. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include selection criteria and a Veterans' Share subsection, ensuring at least 20% of funds for rental assistance. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to include a Veterans' Share subsection, allowing the Secretary to waive or reduce requirements if funds for rental assistance remain unused. SEC. 8. RURAL HOMELESSNESS GRANT PROGRAM. Section 491(c) of the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to ensure that at least 20 percent of grants are used for activities benefiting homeless veterans. The Secretary may waive or reduce this requirement based on grant applications. The Secretary may waive or reduce the requirement for grants under this section if the funds would otherwise go unused for an unreasonable period of time. SEC. 9. INNOVATIVE HOMELESS INITIATIVES DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM. The HUD Demonstration Act of 1993 is amended to require that at least 20 percent of funds received by recipients be used for projects benefiting homeless veterans, with the Secretary having the discretion to waive or reduce this requirement upon request from a jurisdiction. The HUD Demonstration Act of 1993 is amended to allow the Secretary to waive or reduce assistance amounts for recipients if funds remain unused for an unreasonable period of time. Selection criteria for innovative project funding are also updated to include factors necessary for compliance with requirements. The HUD Demonstration Act of 1993 allows the Secretary to ensure that at least 20% of assistance funds benefit homeless veterans, with the option to waive or reduce this percentage based on submitted applications. The HUD Demonstration Act of 1993 allows the Secretary to waive or reduce the percentage of assistance funds benefiting homeless veterans if the funds remain unused for an unreasonable period of time. The definition of 'veteran' in this context refers to section 101 of title 38, United States Code.
